trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter to convert opacity values to and from a string.
Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter>.
Instead, you call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.

For more information about type converters and to view code examples, see the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class and [How to: Implement a Type Converter](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/90373a3f-d8c8-492d-841c-945d62393c56).
Initializes an instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter"></xref> class.
This is the default constructor supplied by the compiler.
Typically, you do not directly create an instance of an <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter>.
Instead, call the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor.GetConverter%2A> method of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeDescriptor> class.
For more information, see the code examples in the <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> base class.
Returns a value indicating whether this converter can convert an object of the specified source type to the native type of the converter that uses the specified context.
The `sourceType` is expected to be a <xref:System.String>.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about the context of a type converter.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> that represents the type you want to convert from.
`true` if this converter can perform the conversion; otherwise, `false`.
Converts the specified object to the converter's native type.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter.ConvertFrom%2A> method is specialized to convert <xref:System.String> values that represent percentages or decimal fractions to their corresponding <xref:System.Double> values, which represent the opacity as a percentage.
Types other than <xref:System.String> are passed to the base class implementation of this method.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about the context of a type converter.
The locale information for the conversion.
The object to convert.
An that represents the converted value.
The object was not a supported type for the conversion.
value could not be properly converted to type .
-or-
The resulting converted value was less than zero percent or greater than one hundred percent.
Converts from the converter's native type to a value of the destination type.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.OpacityConverter.ConvertTo%2A> method is specialized to convert integral values to their <xref:System.String> percentage representations.
Other types are passed to the base class implementation of this method.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that provides information about the context of a type converter.
The locale information for the conversion.
The value to convert.
The type to convert the object to.
An that represents the converted value.
destinationType is `null`.
value cannot be converted to the destinationType.
